item.title: Most People Don't Know How Bikes Work - YouTube
item.description: Most People Don’t Know How Bikes Work - YouTube Steering doesn’t just affect your direction, but balance To turn right, you need to turn left first, and vice versa People countersteer intuitively You use steering to keep the bike underneath you References (References:: Most People Don’t Know How Bikes Work - YouTube)

item.title: Why the Best Place to Live in the US Will Be the [[Rust Belt]] - YouTube
item.description: Why the Best Place to Live in the US Will Be the [[Rust Belt]] - YouTube Weather is very favorable, lots of fresh water in lake, and built around [[Public Transportation]] Very cold, but infrastructure is well adapted for harsh cold References (References:: Why the best place to live in the US will be the Rust Belt - YouTube)

item.title: California High Speed Rail Has Not Failed and RealLifeLore is Wrong - YouTube
item.description: California High Speed Rail Has Not Failed and RealLifeLore is Wrong - YouTube It’s actually suprisingly successful The train track is not straight because it goes around the mountains to save costs The costs Japan’s railroad costed a lot, but nowadays nobody remembers that cost Ballooning Why American Building is Expensive and Slow The reason we is we outsource and outsource, and each layer needs to make profit.

item.title: Electric Cars Are Not Sustainable and They're Terrible - YouTube
item.description: Electric Cars Are Not Sustainable and They’re Terrible - YouTube Electric Cars are terrible. Gas cars are worse Electric Cars take 3-5 years to pay off with the rare earth minerals inside them (that are excavated with lots of CO2) Car infrastructure requires: ^8e4894 More spacing More pipelines More asphault More everything All to serve less people References (References:: Electric Cars are Not Sustainable and they’re Terrible - YouTube)

item.title: Your Two-Day Shipping Needs to Change - YouTube
item.description: Your Two-Day Shipping Needs to Change - YouTube The Case Against Trucks ^1d47fd 99% of damage to roads Only subsidize 35% of road costs Intimidate other drivers Often cause accidents Inherently inefficient Far better with Trains References (References:: Your Two-Day Shipping Needs to Change - YouTube)
